posts.name: Peter Brege
posts.cooked:
Our team recently got a NavX2 Micro so that we can improve our Mecanum Drive as well as automatically balance on the Charge Station. We got the program in LabVIEW to work during Teleop following the example in the User Manual, and we can read values coming from the NavX with the Test Window. However, when we try to use the axis values during Autonomous, nothing works. When we look at the Test Window during Autonomous, none of the values change at all, even when it opens a new test window when Autonomous starts. How do we make it so that the NavX sends those values to the robot during Autonomous?

Our NavX2 Micro is plugged in through USB 1 on the roboRIO at 200Hz.

Here’s the example we followed for the auto-balancing during Teleop.

The Automatic Balancing example demonstrates how to implement a self-balancing robot, which can be useful to help avoid a robot tipping over when driving.  As an example, FRC team 263 demonstrated …

Here’s a rough idea of what our prototype Autonomous is trying to do. When the Test Window opens, the values never change. image 848×474 8.68 KB

image 848×474 8.68 KB

image 848×474 8.68 KB

posts.name: nabgilby - FRC 3707 coding mentor
posts.cooked:
We had the same problem, the navXUI wouldn’t connect either with both of the 2 we bought.  After a few back and forths, with Kauai Labs, they determined that a batch went out w/o flashing the firmware nor calibrating.

You can correct yourself, download this zip, extract, there are instructions, you’ll need to 3D print a jig and alignment frame.

https://studicalimited.sharepoint.com/:f:/s/SR-Resources/Eoe8llkBkNFFldqZt4T4VlcBwJ8bSK0Mb2djDSifSOZtZQ?e=KC6GHK

this link has a zip file with instructions for programming and calibrating the navx2-micro.Minus printing the jig the process should only take about 10 - 15min.

posts.name: Jim simpson
posts.cooked: One thing to try – Remove the timed loop and replace with a regular while loop with a wait inside.   The timed structure does some special things that may be helping to contribute to the problem.

posts.name: Peter Brege
posts.cooked:
Thank you, the firmware update really helped! After updating the firmware in the NavX and putting the Test Window in a timed loop, it’s now accurately reading the correct values. We’re now working on a functioning Autonomous using our Teleop as a basis. We’re able to see the values coming from the Test Window, but so far we haven’t gotten them to be used by the Holonomic Drive VI. We’ve tried setting the motor values to a constant and still nothing happened, so we’re working on getting that to work. Below is the Autonomous that we’re trying to run. We’ll be working on it more the rest of the week.

image 1261×408 11.5 KB

image 1261×408 11.5 KB

image 1261×408 11.5 KB

posts.name: Joshua J
posts.cooked:
If I’m remembering my LabVIEW correctly, everything past the timed loop will never execute because it’s waiting on the loop to completely finish in order for the yaw/pitch/roll data bundle to become available.

You should change your loop to encompass all of the code shown, not just the NavX read, as the code needs to rerun each time the data is updated (which you may need to turn down from 1 kHz, depending on how well the RIO handles it). As shown, even if the drive code did execute, it would only run once because it’s not being looped.

posts.name: Peter Brege
posts.cooked: That worked as well, so thank you for suggesting that! Our robot works perfectly in Autonomous now, so now we just have to map out the rest of the sequence. We’re going to try our Limelight camera now since we were running into the same issue with that as well.
